Reviews.Title: “A good position”
Reviews.Author: Morimoto_Shimpei
Reviews.Content: This Holte is very good. As we were in a trip around Europe I think we find one of the best in Amsterdam! The position is EXCELLENT, is near everything you need the center! The staff was so kind and could help us with every information! The rooms were clean and big and we could sleep well. Thank to the staff and hope to come again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, old-fashioned little hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Fran-and-Pete
Reviews.Content: The owner and staff were lovely - welcoming, helpful and friendly. I arrived early before my room was ready - they were happy to store my luggage. I needed breakfast before their normal time -my meeting started at 8am; they were happy to serve me at 7am. The hotel is full of character and old-world charm - far better than any modern chain hotel. My basement room was very simply furnished but beautifully clean. The only thing I would say, was that the room was rather cold at night. (I was there in mid-March). However, the bed was very comfortable with two warm duvets.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Travellerms89
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after leaving another horrible hotel and it was great. We even had a balcony, the rooms were big, clean and service was great.

Reviews.Title: “1-night stay in March”
Reviews.Author: Sara M Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Towels only fit for cleaning the floor! No bedsyread or throw so was cold in bed - not even a small rug by the bed.. Courtesy tray very poor indeed. Lighting too dim so could not read. Room clean, spacious but oh so plain - nothing attractive at all and I feel it was not good value for money. But adequate for a 1-night stay as nothing awful!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Family Run Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MCL1987
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at Hotel Rembrandt in late August 2011 for 4 nights. We hired the family room which was absolutely fantastic! The family room had 2 levels and plenty of space. We had our own very clean bathroom. The staff were brilliant - very friendly and always helpful. The location was also great - easy access to the centre of Amsterdam and right next to the zoo. The entire hotel was wonderfully decorated, particuarly the dining room. I would highly recommend this hotel and I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Large room, long climb, bad smell”
Reviews.Author: ZippyNNG
Reviews.Content: We had stayed at this hotel before, several years ago, and were happy to return. This time we were given a room at the very top of 4 flights of steep stairs. The staff were happy to help with luggage. The room itself was very large. For the two of us we had a desk with comfortable chair, a table with two chairs, two bedside tables, a wardrobe, a couch, a small refrigerator, and a TV. Plus a nice bed, of course. The wifi in the room worked well. One problem was that, as one often finds in older buildings, there was a very bad smell coming from the toilet in the bathroom. The management had put two solid deodorant things there to try to help, but I think that may have made things worse. Of course there was a door to the bathroom, but the bottom was not flush (no pun intended) with the floor so some smell would always escape. There was a window right in front of the bathroom door, which we left partly open, and that helped. We found the hotel quiet enough--there was a little shouting and dog barking in the night, but for the most part things were quiet. There are several nice restaurants nearby. We did not have the hotel breakfast. Since we have stayed in this hotel before, we know that not all rooms have this smell problem. I would recommend asking for a room that is not on the very top floor.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: kat243
Reviews.Content: Our family of four stayed here and thoroughly enjoyed it. The room was large, the location great as it was about 50m from a tram stop, and the service pleasant. We never tried the breakfast as for four it was quite expensive and we preferred to hop on a tram into the centre of Amsterdam for a cafe. The rooms were very clean and the free Wifi a godsend!! When the trams had a crash one night and stopped running it was about a 30 minute walk from the centre of Amsterdam back to the hotel - not something I would recommend every night, especially with two kids but it is possible.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, clean and tidy place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Debzcoppull
Reviews.Content: Rooms very clean and tidy in a lovely location. Although there was a draughts comin through the window that we had to cover with a towel, it didn't put us off this place to stay. The bed was huge and very comfortable and we would definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, location, staff”
Reviews.Author: SarahD_Dublin
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for five days in August while visiting a friend in Amsterdam. The staff were extremely polite and helpful (which unfortunately is not the norm in Amsterdam), even printing my boarding pass for me before I left. Also, for my birthday I found a bottle of wine and chocolates left in my room, which I thought was a lovely touch. My room was clean and comfortable, and I had an en-suite, which was important to me. The location of the hotel is also great, only a 10 min walk to Rembrandt's former house, and the city centre beyond.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Hotel on a Quiet Street”
Reviews.Author: Yakbutter1
Reviews.Content: I chose hotel Rembrandt due to the price and location. There is a tram stop literally right outside, which was very convenient. There is free WiFi, but it's glitchy. The rooms were very comfortable, a bit small, but very quiet. We ate the breakfast, which was top notch, especially for the price. It's buffet style, so you can get some good eats before a long day. If you like the zoo, that is right next door. But overall it's walking distance (10-15 min) to anywhere of significance in Amsterdam. Service was great too, anyone who was at the front desk was very helpful and courteous. Overall I would recommend Hotel Rembrant for anyone who doesn't want to spend over 100-120 euro a night.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel - would stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: ClarabowNc
Reviews.Content: Good location, accessible by tram from the station, and within walking distance of most everything (central station 20 min walk). This is a family-run hotel with very friendly and helpful staff. Tea and coffee-making facilities in the room, mini-fridge stocked with water, soda and beer. Help-yourself breakfast was well worth it - lots of choices from scrambled eggs to yogurt and fruit- and served in a beautiful room overlooking the garden. Our room overlooked the street, which could be a little noisy with the trams and local traffic, so if you're used to quiet, request a room at the back of the hotel. The room was clean with up-to-date bathroom and hairdryer and all amenities. I was able to borrow an adapter from the front desk for the duration of our stay for my other electrical appliances. Friendly neighborhood bars and restaurants serve excellent food, and the hotel has an agreement with them in case their guests want room service.. This hotel does not offer cookie-cutter type rooms, so if you're looking for a Hilton, please go to a Hilton. This is a charming hotel, with each room decorated differently honoring the legacy of Rembrandt. Well stocked library in the lobby and computer for guests' use. All in all everything we needed to make our stay in Amsterdam special. My only negative: common areas (hallways, etc.) getting slightly worn, and I didn't like the fact that the vacuum cleaner was stored in a corner outside my door - but that is being really picky! I'd recommend it in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Overall nice hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: TeresaOntarioCanada
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 days at the end of June, and were quite happy with most everything about this hotel. Tram #9 is literally steps away from the hotel, so quite handy, it's about a 10-15 minute run from the train station. There are quite a few steps, both getting into the hotel, and to get to your room - not much fun with large suitcases, but once we got to our room we were fine. I can't recall the specific room # we had, but it was a small double. The room was on the small side, but we found the bed to be a bit larger than a double and the room had a mini-fridge which was handy to store some cheese and fruits which we would purchase from the supermarket about 10 minutes away. The room also had a large window, which looked out onto the back of the property so we were able to get some nice fresh air as the first couple days were rather warm in AMsterdam. The front desk staff were always friendly and helpful, and there was free internet available both in the room and at a computer in the lobby area. There was an ATM right across the road to the left when exiting the hotel, so that was handy. So generally we were satisifed with the room and the hotel. We found plenty of reasonably priced restaurants in the Remrandtplein area -- we ate at an Irish pub and an Italian pizza place there the first 2 nights. Our other meals we ate in the Leidesplein area, and these were quite good as well -I would particularly recommend Be Blauwe Hollander where we had some traditional Dutch fare - very hearty and tasty! If we ever to return to Amsterdam, I wouldn't hesitate to stay at the Hotel Rembrandt again - but would perhaps pay a little extra to have a larger room.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay for Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Sup3rgirl
Reviews.Content: The hotel is easy to reach - Tram 9 directly from Centraal Station to the hotel's front entrance. Maximum 10 minutes walk to Rembrandplein, 15 to Leidesplein and 20 to Dam Square. There is also a subway stop 5 minutes away (Waterlooplein) if you need, for example, to go to Amsterdam Arena. We had room 16, third floor, the stairs are a bit of a challenge, but we had a great view and the room (it is the blue one) was lovely - big, nicely decorated and a very comfy bed. The wi-fi works great. The only problem with the room was a weird smell coming from the bathroom, but we kept the door closed and that solved it. We didn't eat breakfast at the hotel, but the minibar prices were very reasonable. Also, we had dinner one day at the cafe just next to the hotel (cafe voogt or something like that). The food was indeed excellent there so we came back the next day for snacks and a glass of wine. It is less crowded than the tourist spots in very popular Rembrandtplein, but it was the perfect choice to end an evening. I would definitely stay there again, it was indeed a pleasant experience

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant hotel but...”
Reviews.Author: esherene
Reviews.Content: We travelled as a family to Amsterdam in June 2011 and stayed at Hotel Rembrandt throughout our 3-day stay in the city. We were a party of five, with two kids under 6 years old. We liked the cosiness of the hotel. It is a small establishment and the staff at the reception are generally friendly and helpful. We got the largest room in the hotel which could accommodate 5 people - a single bed in the main room and 2 double beds upstairs. There is a rather steep staircase leading to these beds and initially, we were worried for our children's safety as they were excited about going up and down it. But with proper caution and warning plus parental supervision, they learnt to be extra careful and we weren't so worried once the 2nd day rolled around. We read several reviews of the hotel and when we read a review that said it was a quiet hotel, we were sold. We had arrived from Paris and were quite exhausted and a good night's sleep was what we sorely needed. However, that was not to be. I believe that compared to the other bigger hotels in the heart of Amsterdam (especially near Centraal Station and around Dam Square), Hotel Rembrandt would indeed be considered in a quiet area as it is away from the crowded, touristy places (which could get very, very crowded). The Plantage Middenlaan is quiet in general. However, we couldn't sleep because of 2 things mainly - the vehicles (cars, trams) travelling on the road right in front of the hotel (and our room faces that road) and the voices we heard at night which I later established to have come from cyclists chatting to each other as they passed by on the bike path (also in front of our hotel). Occasionally, there will be the siren sounds of an ambulance (whether the road leads to a hospital, I am not sure). I think that is the downside of this particular room - that it faces the main road. We are not overly upset about this because it is something which is structural and quite permanent. If you have the tendency to sleep like a log every night, then this wouldn't be a problem at all. But if like me, you are a light sleeper, then it would be problematic. We did not have breakfast in the hotel but in order to get to our room, we had to go through the dining room which we must say is a very beautiful room indeed. Well-maintained and kept. Do take advantage of the many small cards placed outside the reception. Some give discounts to some attractions. We managed to get 20% off per adult ticket to the Hortus Botanicus. We also saw some cards offering discounts to attractions such as the NEMO Centre and the Ann Frank House. There are some that offer dining discounts at certain eating establishments as well. The free wi-fi provided by the hotel is commendable. Do bring your laptops along if you wish but to travellers from countries who have different electricity outlet plugs than the European ones, be warned. Buy a European standard 3-to-2 plug adaptor. When we were in Paris, we borrowed one from the hotel. However, Hotel Rembrandt did not have one to lend us (at the time of our stay) and the only shop we found out that sells them is Aurora (somewhere in town). I was elated to finally purchase one only to find out that each was priced at around 13 Euros. It was daylight robbery - so I changed my mind. My laptop remained out of battery and I had to wait till we returned to London to charge it. There are tram stops outside the hotel. Very convenient. Nos. 9 and 14 are the trams to take if you need to get there (No.9 from Centraal).

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GreeceLoverLondon
Reviews.Content: Easy to find from Central Station - just jump on a No 9 tram which stops almost outside. Greeted by very friend staff and led to Room 2 on Ground floor. Chose this as it has a terrace which leads onto the Garden (we're smokers!) Room was very spacious and bathroom lovely modern and all very clean. Furniture in room looks a little tired but no problem. Had mini fridge/bar which operated on an honest basis. Reasonably priced and when we told them we only had a bottle of water they didn't charge us. Room was cleaned daily and toiletries replaced where needed.. Quiet neighbourhood so perfect after a long day sightseeing. Didn't have breakfast so can't comment on it. Must hand key back to reception when you go out and if they need to leave reception unmanned for a few minutes for any reason they lock the front door which is sensible. Just ring bell if you need to get in and it's closed. There is a large supermarket about 10 mins walk - out of hotel turn right, over bridge then it's on the right hand side. Tram stops for nos 9 and 14 are literally outside the hotel which is so convenient. Amsterdam is a small city so everywhere is walkable but it time is an issue just jump on a tram - easy. We would recommend a GVB travelcard (buy at the station when you are. Leave the station at the main entrance and walk to the left and the office is across the road. It was 15.50 Euros for 72 hours unlimited travel on bus/tram/metro. There is also the i-amsterdam card which is more expensive but gives access to the canal bus and entrance to some museums. We did a boat cruise on the Blue Boat Tours (opp Hard Rock cafe). Anne Frank house - busy but amazing. Would recommend hotel and Amsterdam to everyone. Only there for a long weekend but enough to see and do to last a good week +. Oh and wireless network worked on i-phone in room - network and password in room details.

Reviews.Title: “Recommendation”
Reviews.Author: BelgradeFlapper
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival, we were given keys to the ground floor room- which was very large and even had a sauna in it- but we felt a bit overexposed as the passers by could easily see inside - that would be a typical Dutch experience, but a bit too much for us. We changed the room instantly with no problem for No 11 at the third floor. It was also surprisingly big and very nice. Beds were very comfortable. Free internet connection was a nice touch too. The only downside was a bit weak water pressure in otherwise nice shower cabin. Location turned out to be perfect- walking distance to Dam Square and, basically, everything, but still in a quiet, green area. The hotel staff were relaxed, friendly and helpful. The overall impression of the hotel is that it is a bit worn-out, but charming clean and comfortable. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful place to spend 6 nights away from home”
Reviews.Author: sovta
Reviews.Content: We spent hours on the internet deciding where to spend our 6 nights in Amsterdam. We arrived before check in time but were welcomed by the friendly staff. The staff carried our luggage up the formidable steps to our very large, comfortable room (8) on the first floor. The hotel provided a mini bar & instant coffee in the room. We were able to store our snack food & drinks in the mini bar. We did not eat breakfast in the hotel at an extra 10 euros per person. The location could not have been better, within easy walking distance to Rembrandt Square, The Hermitage, The Zoo (around the corner), The Jewish Historical Museum, The Hortus, The Flower Market and if we couldn't walk we took one of the 2 tram lines less than 50 feet from the front door. The beds were comfortable, the hotel was clean. It was impossible for me to access the WiFi but I was able to use the computer provided in the very comfortable reception area. I'd return in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay here again next stop in Amsterdam!”
Reviews.Author: amytravels2009
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here with our 6 month old son. We loved the location with the tram stop RIGHT outside of the hotel. The 9 and 14 lines take you from the hotel right into central Amsterdam and to all the other sights. The hotel was really clean (we stayed in two different rooms) and they were both nice. We only ate breakfast our last day but it was worth the 10 euro per person. The staff was the best part in regard to this hotel, they were extremely nice and helpful. If you stay here with small children, forget the stroller. The stairways are small and narrow.

Reviews.Title: “What a WONDERFUL experience!!!”
Reviews.Author: adkins5ceo
Reviews.Content: First time traveling to Europe with our 3 children(12, 11, & 9) and the Hotel Rembrandt was the 1st stop on our trip. We were so relieved when we got to the hotel. It was beautiful and the staff were so helpful. Our room (all 5 of us in the family room) was spacious and PERFECT for our family... plenty of clean towels, wonderful shower, and the most comfy beds. The kids really enjoyed looking out the windows and going through the bag of dutch goodies that was left in the room for us. Our 9yr. old daughter left her stuffed animal in the room after we checked out, and they quickly informed us via email and even mailed it back to us... We stayed at several different hotels during our trip, and Hotel Rembrandt, by far, was our absolute favorite. We can't wait to return to Amsterdam, in warmer weather... hopefully, and stay again at this hotel. Wonderful & friendly staff, one-of-a-kind rooms, a lovely dining hall for breakfast, and a great location for families...

Reviews.Title: “we would not hesitate to stay here again”
Reviews.Author: avocetexsydney
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay here - our room was on the first floor, clean with a pleasant outlook,. We we were delighted with the staff and the tram stops at the front door so the location suited us. We enjoyed the local cafes and would not hesitate to stay here again or recommend the hotel. Good self service coffee 24/7 in the dining room as a plus too.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff--happy to stay there again”
Reviews.Author: CoastalBreaks
Reviews.Content: A small (boutique) hotel which appears to be a converted townhouse. This means all rooms are unique (both in decor and size/layout), so some are nicer than others. Our party stayed in 4 rooms, all of which were different. The breakfast room is show-stopping, although the moden chairs and tables clash with the 17th century decor. Pros: Excellent staff: both friendly and helpful. Great location: convenient to a tram stop and walking distance from the centre. We stayed in Room 2 which was a lovely spacious room with an ensuite bathroom. The windows were huge and the ceiling was wonderfully high. The linens were clean and the room was comfortable. The shower was hot and powerful, the bathroom was modern and appeared recently re-done to a good standard, and it came stocked with 3 rolls of toilet paper (which is unusually generous), so no worries about running out! One thing I really appreciated: there was plenty of counter space around the sink to spread out toiletries and things, as well as a little shelf in the shower for shampoo, bodywash, and soap (so many hotels don't have this, leaving you with nowhere to put the soap except the floor), as well as sufficient towel hanging space in the form of a towel hanger in front of the sink and on the wall. There is a computer in reception as well as wifi. Cons: Walls were a bit thin (as can be expected for an old house) so we did sometimes hear noise from other rooms/the corridor. The house-to-hotel conversion could have been done better, as there are some awkward rooms which have not always made the best use of available space. Some of the decor seemed a bit dated--appearing to be from the 1980s. The curtains were the worst--they had an abstract pastel patten that did not match the room decor at all. The desk chair with woven wicker was a monstrosity that didn't match and couldn't fit under the desk, which was missing a drawer. The fake wood laminate flooring looked cheap and wasn't well installed. The tv (not flat screen) was quite small compared to the size of the room. The pillows were a bit lumpy. I didn't care for the breakfast buffet (the bread was lack-lustre and the cornflakes weren't "proper" cornflakes), and after the first day I didn't have any more, but that's a matter of personal taste, as the rest of our party enjoyed it immensely and helped themselves liberally every day. Please note, however: these are only quibbles which are not significant and did not adversely affect our stay. I would happily stay there again, as well as recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great, except..”
Reviews.Author: potatoburekas
Reviews.Content: I don't have much to detailed here, except: This review goes to the lady in the front desk who made a remark about a certain people from certain nationality. well, without going to specific details, that was very rude, un-polite, and ugly. next time when you want to gossip, make sure no guest are around. other than that, the other staff was great, sweet and helpful, the hotel itself is a great value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “They even remembered my birthday!”
Reviews.Author: gymnast46
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were planning to hook up with our adult daughter who lives in London and we selected the Hotel Rembrandt because they could accommodate all of us at a reasonable rate. I had emailed them before arrival asking if we could drop off our luggage early and they promptly responded in the affirmative. The room was spacious and comfortable. The WiFi signal was very strong plus there is a PC in the lobby for use by the guests. We managed to break a coffee cup and lose a borrowed umbrella and they told us not to worry about it. Apparently they noticed from my passport that I would be celebrating a birthday while there and they surprised me with a complimentary bottle of wine! Although not in the center of town, the Hotel is a walkable distance to all the major attractions. I'd heartily recommend the Hotel Rembrandt to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “No Frills”
Reviews.Author: PernicketyTraveller
Reviews.Content: Arrived there on a particularly rainy day and the staff were so nice and helpful. We booked a small double room ensuite, so there wasn't a lot of extra space but we didn't spent that much time in the hotel. The computer in the lobby was useful with free internet. It was in a nice area with various restaurants nearby, and was only a 10/15 minute walk to the very centre. The room and bathroom were nice and clean, with tea/coffee making facilities and a mini fridge with some drinks (which are to be paid for). Its not as up to date as some hotels (eg old style tv) but that wasn't an issue for us. All in all it was definitely good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Plenty of charm and perfect for a short break”
Reviews.Author: Draugen
Reviews.Content: This place is full of character, with books lining the walls of the reception/lounge, huge windows, high ceilings and perhaps most notably, lots and lots of stairs! We were greeted by friendly staff and throughout our visit, every member of staff did their job with a smile and made us feel very welcome. There's a tram stop right outside the hotel (number 9 from Centraal station) or if you prefer to walk, it should take roughly 20 minutes. The hotel is situated in a quiet and attractive area close enough for us to make the most of the city, but also giving a welcome break from the hustle and bustle of the central areas. There are a handful of cafes and bars nearby (we found "Eik En Linde" just opposite the hotel to be very good indeed.) We were given room eleven on the second floor at the front of the hotel which was clean, comfortable and very spacious indeed. The large windows give way to a great view of the street outside, and while there is some noise from trams and people travelling to/from the city, we didn't have any problems. Room facilities are comfortable twin beds, a couch, table and chairs, writing desk, wardrobe, bedside tables,tv, tea and coffee making facilities and minibar. The dark laminate floor and furnishings contrasted well with the mint green walls, which made this an eye catching and relaxing environment to spend the night. The bathroom is big enough to do the job, with WC, sink and a large shower. Free Wi-Fi is also available throughout the hotel, which is a nice little bonus! There were a few areas for improvement as far as the bathroom was concerned: One of the lighbulbs in our bathroom was out and there was a slight smell (from the toilet brush I think). The shower was an exciting looking contraption with jets here, there and everywhere, but in practice it was best just used as a standard shower, possibly as the water pressure wasn't great. These are small things though, and certainly not enough to ruin our visit! Some friends of ours also stayed in the infamous "Small Double Room" (Room 1) which I have seen recieving negative reviews on this site in the past. Personally, I found it to be nicely decorated and quite cosy, I've certainly seen smaller hotel rooms! It does only have one door to the rear as a window, this leads out onto a rather pleasent semi-private garden, which our party made good use of. Overall, this is a friendly, comfortable and characterful hotel in a decent location. There's a few rough edges that could be ironed out, but I'd be more than happy to return!

Reviews.Title: “beware of room no. 6!”
Reviews.Author: iceba
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel for 2 nights of which the first was a real nightmare. the room was about 8 to 10 m2 (including the bathroom) going to the street (trams!), where untel 5.15 in the morning people were shouting. some of which were hotel guests, who slammed their doors when returning and continued their drunken conversation in their room. the room no 6 is a single room with a very narrow bed (80 or 90 centimeters) and costs 75 â‚¬ withour breakfast. For the 2nd night I could move to room 14 (bigger bed, going to the backside of the hotel and therefore quiet). same price, better qualitiy. Anyway: the price is too high for either room. The staff was very polite and helpful! The reception area and the other social areas are cosy and nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel!”
Reviews.Author: retro27
Reviews.Content: This charming little hotel is conveniently located in the central part of Amsterdam near the Artis Zoo. The hotel is right on the tram line. (It's a 10 second walk to the tram stop. Literally right outside the front door) If you want to take the underground Metro, it's just a 5 minute walk away. The staff were very nice and helpful. I stayed here during IBC2010 and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel near the city - plain and with charm and love”
Reviews.Author: Schoenklar
Reviews.Content: I stayed a weekend in this hotel to meet friends in Amsterdam. I got a charming single room full of sunflowers. The room was small, but beautiful and with a good energy. It was calm, also the door to the steps was double and so it was quiet, I could sleep long without disturb. For breakfast there was a buffet, little choice, but fine. Fresh fruit, different kind of bread and rolls, eggs, marmelades, muesli, yoghurt, juices, coffee like your choice out of a automatic coffee maker, tea, hot chocolate. We could have a late breakfast. The room was clean, also the sanitary area and the whole hotel. The staff was friendly and competent, very helpful. I would everytime unhasitatingly come back! The environment is nice and the way into the city by feet short. There is also a tram station nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Gem of a hotel, great location, oodles of character”
Reviews.Author: traveldreamer61
Reviews.Content: Great location. Walking distance to most of the major sights and attractions. A short stroll to Rembrandt's house. One block from the Zoo. Close to the tram lines for those who prefer not to walk. Close to food shopping, bars, cafes and resturants. Our room was at the rear of the hotel on the first floor. The rooms all differ in theme, size and price. Loads of character. Staff are great. Very friendly and helpful and will go out of their way to make your stay pleasant. We caught a taxi from the airport on arrival but walked to the rail staion on departure (about 20mins walk I think). The tram however is right outside the hotel and goes to the rail station. Good prices.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and clean hotel almost in the center of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: roberto4324
Reviews.Content: It's really a good hotel, also for families with young children. It's clean with a very big room for 2 parents and 2 children and it has a good nice old restaurant with an extensive breakfast. Also quit, and next to Artis and in the neighbourhood of the center of Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: mrshabs
Reviews.Content: I travelled for the first time from the US with 2 teenagers to Amsterdam. We stayed in the lovely Hotel Rembrandt. The hotel is housed in an older building with lots of charm. Our room was a triple with one queen sized bed and a daybed with a pull out. Large bay windows overlooked the street and trees. The room was spotless including the modern updated bathroom. The room contained a flat screen TV, desk, and fireplace and couldnâ€™t have been lovelier. The bathroom was fully updated with a large tub/shower combo. We all enjoyed the fact that there was a small fridge in the room containing sodas, water and beer. There is a small room service menu from a local restaurant providing pizza and pasta, the charge can be added to your room bill. The staff all spoke English and were very helpful. Amsterdam was in the middle of a heat wave so we asked for and received a fan for the room. Around the corner were three great places to eat including a hamburger spot, tapas and a bistro all of the food was great. There are also many other bars, cafes, bakeries and take out food in walking distance. The tram system runs right in front of the hotel making getting around super easy and goes directly to the train station.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel, even to stay with kids”
Reviews.Author: frequentravelertoo
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, very convenienty located in a quit residential area, yet within walking distance to Amsterdam Centre. Close to a zoo and a park, which was great for a visit with kids. A tramway line is located right next door. The room was lovely, with a balcony opening to an inner court and garden. In-room coffe was quite helpful.

Reviews.Title: “amazing!! you won't be disappointed”
Reviews.Author: travelbugstudent
Reviews.Content: Pros: Absolutely fantastic staff, spotless room and bathroom, the best shower I've ever seen in a hotel (with jets), coffee and tea making facilities in room, barfridge in room, unbelievably comfortable bed and pillows, the most exquisite breakfast room with chandeliers and classical music and a delicious selection, a french/english/dutch library, free internet, beautiful furnishings, great location!! Cons: only negative thing I could find at all was there was no elevator and the stairs are quite steep - but this is the norm in Amsterdam! Otherwise, PERFECT! You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent hotel and services”
Reviews.Author: So80
Reviews.Content: We stay in a small double room first at basement and at second floor. The hotel is in a very good location, very quiet and very close to the Amsterdam central, near Artis the ZOO. The tram station is very close. The room was very clean and the staff make us a beutiful stay, despite of ash cloud who bloked us another 3 days. They help us with more information about airport news.

Reviews.Title: “Security Competent Staff & Mgmt Comfort”
Reviews.Author: lazar2vangogh
Reviews.Content: Hotel Rembrandt this time gave me a 2nd floor single room in back with big A'dam windows overlooking the blossoming trees in their raw garden courtyard. Good 24 hr security in a good upscale neighborhood near the Artis Zoo if of interest to you and around the corner from the important Resistance Museum. On tram 9 and 14 Plantage Kerklaan stop almost outside the front door 10-15 min. and 2 km from the Centre or more distant from Museumplein. Staff & mgmt are very decent people. Price is excellent 75 euros year round for the single. 10 euros for full American breakfast. In September and December they upgraded me to a double room level with the courtyard. Well-soundproofed rooms. If you bring a radio you can play it. (I don't like TV as I write.) Sign me as 'Room 14'

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, Charming, good location”
Reviews.Author: rondawg
Reviews.Content: This is an old charming hotel with a warm atmosphere. The room I stayed in (room 2) was plain, but very comfortable. The shower was modern and nice. The furniture was a bit worn, but not that important to me. Most importantly it was clean. The staff were very nice and helpfull. They gave great advice on what to do and see, had helpful maps and was allways willing to answer any questions. As for location...it is a bit away from the crowd in the middle of the city. However it only takes about 15 minutes to walk to Dam square and about 20 to central station. It was nice to able to get back to a quite area. If walking is not for you the Tram stops right in front of the hotel. The breakfast room is as nice as the photos show..and the coffee is awsome. The only negative is the price. Its a little high for what you get. Maybe spruce up the furniture or add breakfast to the cost. However, the stay was so comfortable and the staff is so nice I would stay here again, even at the price I paid.

Reviews.Title: “nice but expensive for value”
Reviews.Author: user-marcel
Reviews.Content: This was my second visit to Amsterdam, now with girlfriend. Most of the hotels in center of the Amsterdam are overpriced and it was same with this hotel. Location is good as city center is close enough by walk from hotel (10-20 minutes). Receptionist was very kind person and gave us some advise for sightseeing. We booked room with wooden terrace on the first (higher ground) floor facing silent garden for extra price 10â‚¬ per night, which was was worth money. It was worse with bathroom, which need some upgrades. We enjoyed breakfast on terrace and overall look of the hotel, but building need renovation of wooden stair, which generated serious step-noise during night. Also walls were super thin again (is this common in Holland?), so you could hear every party/cry/beat until 2am when finally whole hotel fall asleep. Hotel is good place for group of friends, but not for couples or families due to night noise - but this could be solved by booking on higher(st) floor. Terrace was nice, but in total it was still overpriced stay. I would rather recommend private apartment.

Reviews.Title: “Wont be going back! Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: NickyTUk
Reviews.Content: I booked the Hotel Rembrandt based on the great reviews on this website and was bitterly disappointed. It was a 3 night stay, over a long weekend, as a present for my boyfriends birthday. I was expecting something cosy, romantic and unique. Sadly what we got instead, was noisy, dirty, old and over priced. I paid the additional â‚¬10 per night for an upgraded room which I had hoped would be romantic. The furniture was falling apart - the drawer front fell off on arrival and it was never fixed, the light fitting was hanging out of the ceiling, the hairdryer caught fire, the balcony doors would not shut and we were unfortunate enough to be below a very noisy family. The rooms are old and have laminate flooring so are very noisy - if you are hoping for early nights and lie ins - forget it! Whilst just outside the centre I did not find it particularly well located and would have rather paid less for a chain hotel closer to the centre. Staff were friendly enough but not overly sympathetic to how noisy the room was! In summary I wouldn't go back. It's not terrible but you could get somewhere much nicer for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Charming reasonable great location”
Reviews.Author: ptOmi
Reviews.Content: The small room is really small but for one person it is clean, designed well and has everything you need, a fully functioning bathroom, tv, wifi, frig, desk, bed and nighttables. My room overlooks a pretty backyard and is very quiet, Breakfast is great and in a huge room. Location on the 9-14 tram is really convenient and walking distance from many interesting museums..

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel - Wonderful Warm Friendly People - A True Home Away From Home”
Reviews.Author: Patrick5000
Reviews.Content: Wow, what an amazing hotel. Everything was perfect. The most amazing thing about the Hotel is the fact that it is run by the most amazing family. Each and everyone of them has a smile and always do their level best to help you and make your stay as great as it possibly can be. They are always extremely friendly, and I could not help but feel the warmth of their welcome, friendliness, and helpfulness. It is truly a home away from home, and when I travel to Amsterdam again I will of course stay there again. I would certainly recommend this Hotel to anyone. The people who run it make it truly special.

Reviews.Title: “Basic and clean but the staff are friendly”
Reviews.Author: stu246
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a few days. The room was basic and some of the furniture looked a little worn and so looked as if it needed replacing, but the room was clean and it had on suite which was the most important thing. The Staff were very helpful. I would reconmend this hotel for anyone who is on a budget who is not looking for bit of luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Small but super hotel in the Centre of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: TheBenjamin55
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff, unique room, romantic garden, great breakfast (very special coffee) in a beautiful antique breakfast room. Hortus Botanicus, Artis Zoo and Hermitage at the Amstel River that we visited during our stay at Hotel Rembrandt all are worthwile and all are nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place and people”
Reviews.Author: BillCorbett
Reviews.Content: My wife and I and our three teenagers enjoyed very much our stay at the Hotel Rembrandt last month. Our eldest daughter is two years away from a possible year of study and travel in Europe, and this is exactly the kind of place we hope she and her friends will be able to stay in. It is family-run, the building is of a piece with the city's architecture, breakfast was charming, and the service was very good. By pre-arrangement I was saved the job of hauling a very heavy piece of photo equipment around the city while we were there. A tram stop is 50 yards from the front door. The price was reasonable and we were very satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “The only place I stay in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Wisconsin_tripster
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent choice in Amsterdam. The hotel is located in a quiet area of the city center with a tram stop right in front, so it's quiet and convenient. The hotel has a very unique quality to it and definitely doesn't have the generic chain hotel feel to it. The staff members are very professional and personable, always ready to assist the weary traveler. The rooms are well-kept and comfortable. The breakfast is well worth the extra charge. The dining room is beautiful. Overall, this hotel is an excellent choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in a great neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: VaBookwriter
Reviews.Content: My second stay here in a few years. On tram 9 fifteen minutes to the Plantage Kerklaan stop from CS. This is a wonderful Amsterdam neighborhood with corner bar Cafe Koosjes, very good restaurants, lots of streetlife near entrance to the zoo. For history buffs, hotel is across the street from the Holland Theatre, the historic Jewish theatre until it was used by the Nazis as a roundup point for Amsterdam Jews sent to the camps. Around the corner of Kerklann toward the zoo is the Museum of the Resistance, a thorough representation of Amsterdam during WW2. The hotel is an old house, the full parlor of which is a book lined lobby with armchairs and desk. Accomodations are up notorious Amsterdam stairs with floors subdivided into basic but clean and comfortable rooms with very nice full bathrooms. I will always stay here when in Amsterdam. Great value, but may require making reservations well before trip. Great staff. WIFI report: free WIFI kept going in and out, and didn't extend into my room on the third floor back of building, so I had to use the hallway with a comfortable settee. They were attentive about solving the problem and offered to move me to a different room, but I muddled through. Love this place.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay in the Family room”
Reviews.Author: CKelWhit
Reviews.Content: Great location and wonderful staff but don't stay in the family room!! It faces the main street and it was so loud. Tram stops right out front, which is great during the day but not at 6 am. Plus 2 out of the 3 nights that we were there we were awakened by loud people. When I say loud I mean loud. Take the loudest night you have ever been woken up from and multiply that by 10 and you will have our first two nights. Also for a family room the bathroom did not have enough shelving space to put all of our stuff.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay in amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: BeezKnuts
Reviews.Content: i stayed here with quite a few people and i dont think any of us had any problems with this place, was nice enough - really steep staircases but i think that is quite common in amsterdam. breakfast area was nice. the hotel was clean and well kept. we only had to go a few yards down the road to be on the main strip so there is no problem getting about. its setback in a quiet area too which i liked because there were a couple of nights i neeeeded sleep and i got it. staff were very friendly and were very helpful. definitley check out the boat tours, they were very interesting. the nightlife is vibrant although i uggest taking cabs out of the center to take advantage of some of the bigger clubs such as 'melkweg' which we had an awesome night in. this hotel should definitly be on your shortlst if you're going to amsterdam

Reviews.Title: “Gret hotel”
Reviews.Author: Assieh
Reviews.Content: The night from the 7th till the 8th of november I stayed in this hotel. I needed some quality time to spend with one of my 3 sons. My first impression that I got when I came in , was a warm welcome. The lobby made me think of a living room where you want to come home to. Home, thatâ€™s the word Iâ€™m looking for. Thatâ€™s the overall feeling I got during my stay. Friendly staff. All of them walk that extra mile to make your stay a nice one. The room we had was romantic, clean and had everything we needed. The reason we choose this hotel was that the information told us it was located near all the sights we wanted to see. This, together with the reasonable price made us decide to stay there. Breakfast was a buffet with different kinds of food. My son especially liked the dutch pancakes. Staff took more then enough time to explain to us the sights to be seen. They even pointed out a restaurant (just around the corner) where we had a perfect dinner for a good price. I think the name was Plancius. Weâ€™ll be back for sure. Maybe around Christmas with the whole familly. Then I think Iâ€™ll take the familly room they have. Iâ€™ve seen that one also . All the rooms there seem to have another look. Warm, welcome, honest, clean and especially very friendly. See you soon again Rembrandt! Thanks for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “not for business people”
Reviews.Author: Traveller11111111
Reviews.Content: If you are in Amsterdam for business dont stay here. this is not a business hotel with printer, elevator and the normal standards. it looks like is a low budget hotel but is actually quite expensive for what it is. the hotel does a great job with pictures from the rooms on their website and you get a feel that this is a cool boutique hotel. it is not. Beware!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: lexd25
Reviews.Content: I have just come back from a stay at this lovely hotel, i was a bit dubious but am so glad that i went for the small , family run hotel instead of a big chain , it added to the amsterdam experience....The staff are really friendly and give you lots of useful tourist info and nothing is too much trouble...we had room 17 which was up 5 flights but this didnt bother us (usually i would moan) as it felt like our own floor in the attic, the room was a tiny bit dated but this added to the overall charm and they have everything you need and the beds are the most comfortbale EVER!! The location of the hotel is really good its alot more resisdential but there is a few bars, a coffee shop, an atm all in 1 mins walk and the tram stop is right outside the hotel. Tram number 9 takes you into the centre within 5 mins and also rembrandplien in 2 mins where you will find a more classy side to the city with chic bars , clubs and resturants , this can all be easily walked though if you dont want to get a tram...all in all we choose this hotel as the price was really really good compared to the other hotels in the are we paid 145 each for 3 nights ina large double room , that was how much the other hotels were asking per night!! I would definatley stay here again, usually i like being in the main area when i go away being a young twenty something but if i did there were parts of amsterdam i wouldnt of found the hotel area is really nice , theres a little park, a canal and even a zoo!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in good safe location”
Reviews.Author: racingqueen
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from this hotel and had a great stay. Cannot understand the previous review re smoking as this is a non smoking hotel and they definitley do not allow it! We had a huge room which was very clean. Towels changed every day. Mini bar was very reasonable prices. Trams stop outside the hotel . We bought a 3 day pass which cost us 14 euros from Central station. There are some very good bars and restaurants close to the hotel and were much cheaper than in the centre. The hotel is looking very drab in places, yet still retains such lovely character.

Reviews.Title: “convenient but very smoky!”
Reviews.Author: rocketstef
Reviews.Content: Clean, excellent location, spacious room. But big problem--we are not smlkers. Guests and employees hung out in the library/fromt sitting room constantly smoking. Drifted up the stairs. Our room, the hallway, downstairs, everywhere reeked thickly from the smoke. Drove us crazy! My kids were constantly coughing. Also, about the breakfast: The breakfast room was really very cool. But the spread left to be desired. Nothing particularly home made or delicious, just standard store-bought goods. By the end of our trip, we skipped it entirely even though we paid for it. Although it did have some good qualities, i would not return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, decent stay!”
Reviews.Author: nwra
Reviews.Content: We found our stay in Amsterdam to be amazing. This Hotel was reasonably priced and we had no problems with it. All the staff spoke English and were a massive help. The Library and Breakfast room are lovely. Some of the decoration is a little tired in places, but you are there to see the city, not spend all your time in the Hotel! If you are looking for a cheap stay and looking to avoid a hostel i reccommend this Hotel. The trams outside are very frequent making the Hotel very accessible. The only negative was the towels. They were quite small and thin. Que Sera Sera!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: elicyn
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel in 2002. After searching online for weeks I fell in love with the look and feel of the hotel on their website. At that time the price was about half the price now and included breakfast. I stayed in the single room and it was large enough and quite comfortable. The bathroom was incredible, spotlessly clean and looked as if it had just been remodeled. I loved the wood floors, much better than carpet. The staff was polite and the lobby cozy with all the books and chairs positioned by the windows. My friend, a native of the Netherlands, came to visit me there and also liked the hotel. The only down side I saw was there is no lift and the stairs are quite steep and the location is a bit far from Central Station, but still within walking distance. I had severe jet lag while I was there and could not get to sleep at night as my room faced the street and the tram track, but it was nice to look out at the pedestrians. I would highly recommend Rembrandt Hotel and will probably stay there again myself in spring of 2009. This hotel beats everything else I've seen online even if a bit higher I think it's well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the tram.”
Reviews.Author: mrskeegin
Reviews.Content: My husband and I saw a recommendation for this hotel in one of the travel books we purchased when planning our trip for Amsterdam. It said it was family friendly and cheap. It was close to a tram stop which was perfect, but unfortunately it was a bit far from all the things we loved to do the most while in Amsterdam. (New Market, De Waag, Red Light District). The good thing is that you can walk around Amsterdam very easily. Breakfast was included in the cost of the room which was great, we stayed a week and were getting tired of the same breakfast items, so we ventured out into the city for an "English Breakfast" once or twice. Rolls, meat and cheese slices, fruit, hard-boiled eggs, granola-type cereals and milk / orange juice were available every morning. Service was great, the women working the front desk were very helpful. We were able to arrange for an airport taxi - they did all of it for us. They had internet access available for a few Euros. Room was small, but adequate for what we needed. Bathroom was especially nice. TV with Dutch and BBC channels, and a clock. Very very comfortable beds. No air conditioning which didn't bother us because it was chilly enough without it. It was very quiet from Sunday to Tuesday, but we woke up Wednesday morning to the sound of screaming children. Maybe there was a daycare right next door (?). That was a bit annoying. Our room was facing the back yard, so we never heard the trams go by.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: vagabond25
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Rembrandt on December 31 - January 5 and very much liked this hotel. I must admit that my first impression was not the best though and it turned out to be wrong. What I found positive about this hotel is that its location is very good, it's situated close to the city center and you can either walk or take a tram (tram stop is just a hundred steps away from the hotel door) to get there. It's quietness and safety that you appreciate so much after spending time in crazy city center. First night I stayed in a double room, it was not that spacious but had everything one might need in it. The rest of nights I spent in a single room as requested and this room was very nice, more spacious, had a very clean bathroom and a very large window which I liked too. The only thing I wasn't comfortable with was kinda dark light, just would have prefered to feel the difference between room with light on and off. Breakfast was ok, there was all kinds of food you need in the morning, and yes, coffee was great. Of course dining room was amazing, it looked like an antique one. Unfortunately I didn't get much information from the staff on the building and dining room history, so have no idea if it's a genuine one but will keep thinking it is))). It was my first (and I hope not the last) trip to Amsterdam and I have no other hotel experience in this city but if I go there next time I wouldn't mind staying in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, curteous, clean and accommodating”
Reviews.Author: MammaJamma
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Rembarndt late May for a week. We had never been to the Netherlands before so it was a new experience for us and we had no idea what location would be best for us. The hotel is in a great location about a 5 minute walk to Mac Bikes, for bike rental. Just around the corner from the Zoo and about again 5 minutes from the grocery store. The staff were very helpful and new english perfectly. The called our cab when we were leaving for the airport and knocked on our door to make sure we were up in time. The breakfast area was beautiful and the food was fresh and tasty. No bacon or eggs just good healthy food like fruit and assortment of cheese and ham and fresh bread. Cearl with milk or yougurt, boiled eggs and fresh coffee or tea. The room was a little run down and could probably use a little rennovations but for what we paid it was well worth it. Our room was a small double with a large window looking over on the backyard, you cold open the windows fully and step outside on a small balcony. The bathroom was great, clean and newly rennovated. Be warned that most channels on the Tv were in Dutch, which is understandable, but if you wanted to watch movies in English then you had to pay but it was fairly inexpensive. They came in and cleaned everyday and left fresh bags for coffee and clean towels. Overall for the price that you pay it is really worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint and practical, convenient to transportation and attractions”
Reviews.Author: RngMma
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 10 days in early April (work and vacation) and were pleased with the service and the facilities. Though it's a hotel, it felt more like a bed and breakfast, which was a nice surprise. When we got off the tram, I thought the place looked a bit shady with its overgrown unruly ivy, but the inside was just fine, warm and welcoming. We started in a small double in the basement or ground floor (hollywood theme) -- all yellow with basic furnishings, great bathroom and no problems except no windows to open for fresh air and unfortunate proximity to a room where a guest was smoking. There was a door leading out to the backyard, but we couldn't sleep with that open, as there wasn't a screen. We were later able to switch to a smaller small double right next to the breakfast room (the sunflower room). Though it was a tighter squeeze, we enjoyed having windows, lots of light and fresh air and a view of the backyard. Breakfast was pleasant and ample and offered in the hotel's flagship room. Rooms were cleaned each day and staff members were helpful. The location is quiet and residential but still convenient to public transportation, a cash machine and two quite good cafes for nights when you don't want to head to more tourist-laden areas. Waterlooplein is a 10-minute walk and other areas are not much farther. The hotel is next to a school, so the crowds of students may be a surprise if you happen to be there midday. But overall, a pleasant place for travelers who don't need luxury but can appreciate practical, clean, convenient and quaint quarters.

Reviews.Title: “Treat with caution”
Reviews.Author: GabriellaLondon
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at the Rembrandt partly because it was one of the few hotels available over the bank holiday and because it had a very good write up in a travel guide; which now leaves me slightly suspicious that the author of the guide didn't actually put his foot inside the door. This is a worn hotel, in the corridors the wall paper needs a good lick of paint, the carpet is thread bare and its all seen better days. We'd booked a small double and were apologetically told when arriving that the double bed in the room was very small and we'd be moved to a bigger room the next day at no extra cost. We were presented with what looked like a large single bed in a room which was a homage to chip board and "wood effect" all rounded off with laminate floors that could have fooled no one. The whole room looked like a hostel on Earls Court Road. To be fair, the bathroom was clean and modern and obviously recently refurbished ( but why stop there...) Although this appears a quiet area by day its really noisy by night. The next day, as promised, we were moved into a bright double room with a little terrace over looking a rather wild garden. If you are offered a small double; I would ensure that it is one on the web site; the one we were allocated was dire. In terms of location its about a 15 ish minute walk to DAM square and about 25 to the station, but its a rather nothingy, dull area, lacking any buzz and the sort of scenes that make you want to visit Amsterdam in the first place.

Reviews.Title: “If you want to sleep, get a room in the rear........”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Nice big Family room for 5. Second floor loft for the kids. Nice breakfast room. Now the bad news, if you don't mind Trolly's at all hours of the night 50' from your room this is for you. Loud, Loud, Loud. We left after 2 nights out of 4 and went to the Best Western down the street.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: syll
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my sister last month in the hotel Rembrandt for three days. Had a great stay; loved the antique breakfastroom and the international library. Room was spacious with a recently renovated bathroom. Hotel had enough luxury for us; cable TV, telephone and hairdrier. We especially liked the hot water kettle in the room so we could make our own coffee and tea (which was supplied every day for free ) The staff was friendly without being pushy.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and basic”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Rembrandt for four nights in early November. The furnishings are basic, a little worn, but everything seems very clean. There is absolutely no smattering of luxury at this hotel. Our room, while spacious, was very beige, empty, echo-y and cold. The towels were worn thin and the toilet ran all the time. The hotel staff were generally very pleasant, but in a forced sort of way. The location is good, however. All the "action" is just a 10-minute walk away (whatever "action" you prefer!). The zoo and Hortus are practically right next door. Since we prefer a tad more service and comfort when we travel, we'll probably stay somewhere else on our next trip. But I would still recommend it to someone looking for basic accommodations at a good price.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Rembrandt
HotelInfo.Address: Plantage Middenlaan 17, Amsterdam 1018 DA, The Netherlands
